reports.title: name="The Last of Us™ Part I" appid="1888930" target_framerate="30-39 FPS" title="Steam Deck - Prefer Quality"

data.game_name: The Last of Us™ Part I
data.game_display_settings:
- **DISPLAY MODE:** BORDERLESS WINDOWED
- **DISPLAY RESOLUTION:** 1280x800
- **V-SYNC:** OFF (Locking the Frame Limit in Steam Deck Performance is better than using V-Sync)
- **FRAMERATE CAP:** 40
- **ANTI-ALIASING MODE:** DEFAULT
- **SCALING MODE:** DEFAULT
- **RENDER SCALE:** 90 (you can set this to 80 to reduce frame dips below 30FPS, but I preferred a prettier picture over a steady framerate)
data.game_graphics_settings:
- **DRAW DISTANCE:** LOW
- **DYNAMIC OBJECT LOD:** LOW
- **CHARACTER LOD:** LOW
- **ENVIRONMENT LOD:** LOW
- **TEXTURE FILTERING:** ANISOTROPIC 1X
- **TEXTURE SAMPLING QUALITY:** LOW
- **AMBIENT SHADOW QUALITY:** QUARTER RESOLUTION
- **DIRECTIONAL SHADOW RESOLUTION:** LOW
- **DIRECTIONAL SHADOW DISTANCE:** MEDIUM
- **IMAGE BASED LIGHTING:** OFF
- **DYNAMIC LIGHTS QUALITY:** VERY LOW
- **SPOTLIGHT SHADOW RESOLUTION:** LOW
- **POINT LIGHT SHADOW RESOLUTION:** LOW
- **BOUNCED LIGHTING:** OFF
- **SCREEN SPACE SHADOW QUALITY:** MEDIUM
- **DYNAMIC SCREEN SPACE SHADOW:** ON
- **CONTACT SHADOW QUALITY:** LOW
- **SCREEN SPACE AMBIENT OCCLUSION:** ON
- **AMBIENT OCCLUSION DENOISE QUALITY:** LOW
- **SCREEN SPACE DIRECTIONAL OCCLUSION:** OFF
- **SCREEN SPACE CONE TRACING:** OFF
- **SSR:** ON
- **SSR ACCURACY:** 10
- **SSR DISTANCE:** 10
- **SSR GLOSSY QUALITY:** 10
- **RT REFLECTIONS:** OFF
- **RT CLOUD SHADOW REFLECTIONS:** OFF
- **SCREEN SPACE SUB SURFACE SCATTERING:** ON
- **REFRACTION QUALITY:** HALF RESOLUTION
- **DEPTH OF FIELD:** CINEMATICS ONLY
- **DEPTH OF FIELD QUALITY:** ULTRA
- **MOTION BLUR:** OFF
- **BLOOM RESOLUTION:** HALF RESOLUTION
- **EFFECTS DENSITY:** VERY LOW
- **VOLUMETRIC EFFECTS QUALITY:** LOW
- **LENS FLARE:** HALF RESOLUTION
- **ANIMATION QUALITY:** MEDIUM
- **AMBIENT CHARACTER DENSITY:** VERY LOW
- **AI QUALITY:** LOW
data.additional_notes: Audio is crackling with latest versions of Proton Hotfix and Proton Experimental. Even the latest (at time of writing) GE-Proton9-20 has some major audio issues at various points in the game. Download and configure the game compatibility to use the older GE-Proton9-16 and the audio crackling is almost entirely fixed (with the exception of a few very minor points in the game). I tried a few versions, this is the latest version that worked for me. Versions 9-2 to 9-16 seemed fine, then 9-17 has borked audio again.

data.additional_notes: This will chew through your battery. You will also need to configure your device to run on the "Turbo (25/30W)" TDP Mode.

labels.name: DEVICE: ASUS ROG Ally Z1 Extreme
labels.description: ^(ROG Ally Z1 Extreme|ASUS ROG Ally Z1 Extreme)$

gameName: The Last of Us™ Part I
reports_summary: User feedback indicates The Last of Us Part I generally sits in the low 30s on both the Steam Deck LCD and the ROG Ally when prioritising quality, producing a mixed but mostly acceptable experience with occasional dips. Reports called out audio crackling on the Deck with recent Proton builds, and reverting to an older Proton build largely fixed it. An FPS cap around 40 and using an image upscaler were the main ways players steadied performance, and the Ally’s roughly double power draw means much shorter battery sessions compared with the Deck.
